fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a parent task is converted to sub-task and the parent task has Sprint value in customfieldvalue table, that specific value is not deleted. 

(i) Customfieldvalue entry is removed when parent task is deleted when an issue is moved from a Sprint to Backlog

Steps to reproduce:

# Create a Story issue.
# Add the issue to a Sprint.
# Check the customfieldvalue and there'll be an entry with the newly created issue's issue ID.
# Open the issue page and convert the issue to sub-task.
# Check the customfieldvalue table again and the entry will still remain on the table.


h3. Environment

JIRA 7.5.2, 7.5.1


h3. Expected Results

JIRA deletes the Sprint customfieldvalue entry of the converted sub-task


h3. Actual Results

JIRA retains the Sprint customfieldvalue entry of the converted sub-task


h3.Workaround

None
fields.summary: JIRA does not delete Sprint customfieldvalue entry of converted sub-task

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Two dimensional filter statistics gadget's behaviour has changed since previous versions. If any issues have None value for some custom field, these tickets aren't counted in the gadget and there are no empty values (None) entries shown in the gadget (at least for multi-select-list custom fields).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create custom field with multiple choices (eg. custom field named Browsers, can have internet browser as options - IE, Edge, Firefox, Chrome etc.)
 # Create a simple filter like "project = TEST and issuetype = Bug"
 # Add Two dimensional filter statistics gadget to your dashboard specifying the filter from Step 1
 # Set XAxis = Issue Type
 # Set YAxis = some multi-select-list custom fields,  eg. Browser(s) field that has Internet browsers as options; Sort By, Sort Direction, Number of Results and Auto refresh settings - seems it does not matter what you put there
 # Save the filter.

h3. Expected Results
Newly created gadget should show complete breakdown, including number that counts issues having None as a YAxis custom field's value (screenshot attached).

h3. Actual Results
Newly created gadget doesn't include issues having None as a YAxis custom field's value. There is no row which displays None as a field value followed by issue count (screenshot attached).

h3. Notes
The bug doesn't exist in versions 7.1.9 (tested by customer) and 7.3.8 (tested by Atlassian Support).
It exists in both 7.5.0 and 7.5.1 versions.

h3.Workaround
No
fields.summary: Two dimensional filter statistics gadget does not show empty values

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

During a project import a validation message shows up indicating a mandatory user could not be created, however, clicking the View Details options renders a blank result set.
Here is the error that is displayed in the UI:
{code}
There are '1' required user(s) that JIRA can not automatically create.
{code}

The problem with this message is that it is incomplete and doesn't provide any helpful information regarding how to fix the XML backup used for the project import.


h3. Suggested Solution

Change the error message to something more explicit to help the admin user figure out how to fix the XML backup.
 
h3. Workaround 

There are 2 known root causes to this issue, and a workaround for each of them:
# The XML backup.has issues assigned to a blank/null user due to unknown cause (issue addressed in the KB article [Project Import Failed due to Blank Missing Mandatory User|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/project-import-failed-due-to-blank-missing-mandatory-user-865045675.html/]). The workaround consists in fixing the entities.xml file with this command:
{code}sed -i 's/assignee=""//g' entities.xml{code}
# The XML backup. has components with leads that are blank null users (lead="") due to unknown cause. The workaround consists in fixing the entities.xml file with this command:
{code}sed -i 's/lead="" //g' entities.xml{code}
fields.summary: Improve user related error message during a project import

fields.description:
h3. Definition

Currently, the JQL used after clicking on Bulk Change from issue navigator is based on the Current Search JQL. This means that there are situations where the issues listed in the page's issue navigator is not based on the Current Search JQL.

Eg:

# Two tabs are open, TAB_A and TAB_B. Both are on an issue navigator page.
# TAB_A shows a list of issues based on JQL_QUERY_A.
# TAB_B shows a list of different issues based on JQL_QUERY_B.

Expected results: Clicking on bulk change from TAB_A, the changes made are affecting issues from JQL_QUERY_A.

Actual results: Clicking on bulk change from TAB_A, the changes made are affecting issues from JQL_QUERY_B.

h3. Suggestion

Bulk change should use the JQL used from the issue navigator page instead of Current Search to reduce confusion among users.
fields.summary: Bulk change to use JQL from page that it is accessed from

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When editing the text color by using the Editor panel for existing colored text in Visual mode, the color does not change as expected.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Put some text in the comment box in Visual mode
# Highlight the text and edit the color by using the "Text Color" on Editor panel
!color.png|thumbnail!
# Save the comment
# Edit the comment and try changing the text color in the same way

h3. Expected Result
The text should change to the latest chosen color.

h3. Actual Result
The text color remains unchanged in the comment box, however it's changed properly upon saving the comment.

h3. Notes
This is because a new color tag is added outside the existing color tag (which can be seen in Text mode). Example:
* At step 2:
{code}
{color:#de350b}colored text{color}
{code}
* At step 4:
{code}
{color:#4c9aff}{color:#de350b}colored text{color}{color}
{code}
So, the color of the text remain unchanged in the comment box, but changed once the comment is saved.

h3. Workaround
When editing the text color and noticing the above behavior, switching to Text mode then switching back to Visual mode will allow the new color to be reflected properly in the comment box.
fields.summary: Edit Text Color Not Working as Expected

fields.description:
h4. Problem

The [Configuring advanced settings configuration for JIRA 7.3.x and below|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver073/configuring-advanced-settings-861253966.html] used to reference the *jira.bulk.create.max.issues.per.import* parameter. Since [version 7.4.x+|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver074/configuring-advanced-settings-881684142.html] the parameter is not listed anymore, without any obvious reason. Other parameters have also changed, without [explicit mention in the 7.4.x+ release notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftware/jira-software-7-4-x-release-notes-902079634.html], so it would be worth reviewing those as well.
h4. Suggestion - proposed fix

Review the missing parameters and add them to the 7.4.x and 7.5.x documentation respectively. While working on it, it would be worth to clarify the performance/memory-demand implications of adjusting the default value.

See the internal comment below for the discussion with DoS and references to why the above seems to be a mistake.
fields.summary: Documentation request/fix: add jira.bulk.create.max.issues.per.import to 7.4.x+ docs

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In some unidentified cases {{optionconfiguration}} table has logical duplicates. In some cases it can cause performance problems: see JRASERVER-42282

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Run SQL
{code:borderStyle=solid}
// Check all duplicated options, query should return 0
SELECT fieldid,optionid,fieldconfig, count(*) FROM optionconfiguration group by fieldid,optionid,fieldconfig having count(*)>1
{code}

h3. Expected Results
Select returns 0 results

h3. Actual Results
Select return non zero results:
{noformat}
OPTIONID	FIELDCONFIG	COUNT(1)
11900	10000	4
12306	10000	4
...
13982	10000	18
14022	10000	18
14024	10000	18
...
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
Table description:
{noformat}
\d optionconfiguration
       Table "public.optionconfiguration"
   Column    |         Type          | Modifiers
-------------+-----------------------+-----------
 id          | numeric(18,0)         | not null
 fieldid     | character varying(60) |
 optionid    | character varying(60) |
 fieldconfig | numeric(18,0)         |
 sequence    | numeric(18,0)         |
Indexes:
    "pk_optionconfiguration" PRIMARY KEY, btree (id)
    "fieldid_fieldconf" btree (fieldid, fieldconfig)
    "fieldid_optionid" btree (fieldid, optionid)
{noformat}
Example:
{noformat}
select * from optionconfiguration limit 10;
  id   |  fieldid  | optionid | fieldconfig | sequence
-------+-----------+----------+-------------+----------
 10512 | issuetype | 3        |       10300 |        0
 10513 | issuetype | 5        |       10300 |        1
 10514 | issuetype | 10100    |       10300 |        2
{noformat}


h3.Workaround
If the above SQL returns any rows, you are affected by the problem. In this case, please raise a ticket on https://support.atlassian.com, referring to this bug report and ask for assistance on de-duplicating the table.
fields.summary: logical duplicates in the optionconfiguration table

fields.summary: Keep full username when user is deleted from an external directory

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Consecutive Issue navigation/search impacts performance (possible memory leak)

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Perform an issue search
# Click on one of the issues that were result of the search
# The top right of the View Issue screen has the navigation option to move back and forth through the issue search result, click on it:
!search.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected results
The action is done, the issue is scrolled to the next/previous and there is no performance impact.

h3. Actual results
# After each click to change the issue (and the issue is actually loaded), browser's memory increases. 
# This increase seem to be higher on each subsequent issue that you scroll through
# After 30-50 issues, each time you navigate through an issue, about 60m+ increases on the memory usage of the Google Chrome's tab
# It seems like the browser identifies the whole process as one single request. You can noticed through the .HAR file that it is logged as a single request that reaches multiple issues.

This will go on until the whole browser ends up crashing. 
Tested on Google Chrome version 62.0.3202.89 and Firefox 56.0.2.

h3. Workaround
Opening each issue on new tabs or windows instead of using the top right arrows on the Issue Navigator.
fields.summary: Consecutive Issue navigation/search impacts performance (possible memory leak)

fields.description:
The HTML specification has a tag, [{{<wbr>}}|https://www.w3.org/TR/2010/WD-html-markup-20101019/wbr.html], to provide an _opportunity_ for a line-break in a place that would otherwise be non-breaking (i.e. a long string of consecutive non-whitespace characters). It'd be handy to be able to make such an indication in many descriptions, comments, etc. in JIRA, but as best I can determine, the only way I can accomplish that right now is to enable the Wiki Rendering HTML Macro, and then {{\{html\}<wbr/>\{html\}}} whenever I want it.

It'd be great if I could use {{(wbr)}} or something to achieve this without resorting to enabling HTML rendering.
fields.summary: Create formatting tag for line-break opportunity (<wbr/>)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

If the board contains about 3000 versions, the loading of the page will be very slow.


h3. Suggested Solution

# Improve the loading of the Versions on the board or 
# Allow archiving of released versions and provide option to use to set default "Version filter"


h3. Workaround 

Archive the Version using the following REST API:

* https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/server/#api/2/version-updateVersion

{code}
curl -H "Content-Type: application/json" -X PUT --user admin:admin -d '{"archived": true}' http://127.0.0.1:8080/rest/api/2/version/10003
{code}

After archiving, click on *Released or Unreleased* filter in the Versions page to prevent JIRA from loading archived Versions.
fields.summary: Improve Versions page loading in JIRA

fields.description:
In most of Jira, "fixVersion" is used, but for the JSON importer, it expects "fixedVersions"

Examples of usage for "fixVersion":
* CSV import: https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver072/importing-data-from-csv-829827152.html
* JQL searches: https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver072/advanced-searching-fields-reference-829092671.html
* REST endpoint: /rest/api/2/field

When JSON import uses "fixedVersions":
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver072/importing-data-from-json-829827228.html


We should ensure that all references are the same.
fields.summary: JSON Importer uses fixedVersions instead fixVersion

This is a feature request to address the various inconsistent editor experience between JIRA and Confluence. While the two products are fundamentally different, there are many overlapping options which can be aligned to create a smoother user experience. Some of them are minor details such as ordering of menu sections, or ordering of the options inside dropdowns.

Please see the screenshots below.

||Item||JIRA||Confluence||
|Text styles|!editor_jira_style.png|thumbnail!|!editor_conf_style.png|thumbnail!|
|Font colors|!editor_jira_fontcolors.png|thumbnail!|!editor_conf_fontcolors.png|thumbnail!|
|Text formatting|!editor_jira_textformat.png|thumbnail!|!editor_conf_textformat.png|thumbnail!|

fields.description:
Currently, adding multiple components only notifies and assigns the ticket to the 1st person in the list. Once that person is done with it, they are then required to change the assignee to the next person on the list and so on so everyone can handle their component. This is very serial and doesn't work very well as there are time we need to work in tandem.

It would be great if, when adding components there would be an additional option drop down that you could set to automatically assign the component lead to a be participant on the ticket and thus notifying them of the issue automatically.  

 

JIRA Service Desk - Server - 3.X
fields.summary: Creating a component, the assignee automatically becomes a Requested Participant

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Jira 7.4.4 and 7.5.0 seem to have a change where search issue limits are not respected, somewhat similar to [JRASERVER-63239|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63239]

h3. Environment

Problem happens in Jira 7.4.4 and Jira 7.5, but the behavior is different in Jira 7.5.1 and 7.5.2
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have more than 1000 issues in your instance
# Access the issue navigator and search for all of them
# Export these issues to CSV

h3. Expected Results

The application will present a 403 error as noted in [Limiting the number of issues returned from a search view such as an RSS feed|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver075/limiting-the-number-of-issues-returned-from-a-search-view-such-as-an-rss-feed-935391848.html]

h3. Actual Results

In Jira 7.4.4 and Jira 7.5.0, you can still export all issues you search for to CSV, however, in 7.5.1 and 7.5.2, you are presented with a 403 as would be expected to prevent the limit from being bypassed.

h3. Workaround

Set your {{jira.search.views.default.max}} and {{jira.search.views.max.limit}} to a higher number.
fields.summary: Export to CSV does not respect search issues limit

fields.description:

h2. How to reproduce
Create a swimlane based on a filter that will show only one issue.
Set JIRA language to French

h2. Expected results
The label on the swimlane says it has 1 issue

h2. Actual results
The label on the swimlane says it has 11 issues, despite only showing one issue
fields.summary: Swimlanes labels with only one issue show the wrong amount of issues when JIRA is in French language

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The documentation of the Rest API (https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/server/) does not provide enough information to use it. For example, have a look at the method to search for users here: https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/server/#api/2/user-findUsers

The documentation doesn't state any minimal required parameter so users who attempt to run the query without parameters will only find out from the error message.

Apart from that, no information given about the data which can be used to perform calls. For example, have a look at the method to add worklog here: https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/server/#api/2/issue-addWorklog

No information is given for timeSpent and timeSpentSeconds. Users will have to use them first to understand what the differences between them are

h3. Suggestion
Improve the documentation by adding all these details, making it easier for users to use REST API without having to learn by trial and error.
fields.summary: Include more details in REST API documentation

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When a customer tries to update from an older version to the latest, sometimes the JIRA Update Check will give a warning that their latest version of a specific Atlassian add-on is not compatible.

The reason for this is because some of the Atlassian add-ons have been superseded in one of the versions in between their current and the latest.

E.G;

* Instance Health
* Support Tools
* Support Healthcheck

have been superseded in 7.4.3

h3. Suggested Solution
These Add-ons are in house so we should be able to verify if add-ons are superseded or not, JIRA Support Check should suggest the new Add-ons that will be installed with the new version.
 
h3. Workaround
Manual lookup of Add-on information.
fields.summary: Show the new add-on for superseded atlassian add-ons in JIRA Update Check

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Definition*
Currently when using exchange server as SMTP server in JIRA, when we have users with valid email address and invalid email address using *sent email* feature result in none of the users receive email.

Below error is thrown at JIRA side UI:
 !mail error.JPG|thumbnail! 

However, removing the invalid user result email to be sent successfully using *send email* function.

h3. *Suggested Solution*

Currently, this behavior happens in certain mail server such as exchange server due to the fact JIRA send one bulk email to multiple recipients hence when some recipient has invalid email address it results in all the users not receiving the email from JIRA when using *send email* function.

Allow email sent from *send email* function to be sent the same way of notification being sent when we create or update issue. Currently, when we create or update issue each JIRA will send a separate email to each recipient. Having this feature for *send email* function will be helpful to avoid mail not being sent to anyone when invalid email is present.

h3. *Additional Note*
* Note that this behavior is mail server specific whereby normally experienced in exchange mail server/Enterprise Mail server and the same behavior does not happen when using Gmail server.

h3. *Workaround* 
* Make sure invalid email address account is not selected when using the *send email feature*
fields.summary: Allow Separate Mail To be Sent To Each Recipient When Using Send Email Function In JIRA

fields.description:
Documentation on the default permission specification was not found.
I would like to read the specification of the default authorization scheme.
fields.summary: What is the default permission scheme setting?

fields.description:
DVCS link to the wrong repository when create a pull request from a private user account instead of team account.

For example:
If there are 2 Bitbucket account:
- *AtlassianTestTeam* (Team Account)
- *Atlassianprivate* (User private account)

The *AtlassianTestTeam* account is already associated to JIRA through DVCS, but when create a branch using the *Atlassianprivate* account It’ll make the JIRA associate the branch with the Team account instead of User Private account. The JIRA will link to:
{quote}https://bitbucket.org/AtlassianTestTeam/atlassian_test/branch/TEST-1-dvcs{quote}
Instead of 
{quote}https://bitbucket.org/Atlassianprivate/atlassian_test/branch/TEST-1-dvcs{quote}

The link will generate error 404 due to wrong link into JIRA.

h4. Steps to reproduce:
# Create JIRA issue
# Create branch in private user account using *Create Branch* button in JIRA issue. (No link in JIRA to branch at this point)
# Create pull request from private user account into team 
# Branch link shows up in JIRA
# Branch link is 404 because it assumes team account not private user account
fields.summary: JIRA link to the wrong repository when the branch is from a pull request merging from a fork

fields.description:
Hello,

 

We are currently testing SAML for Atlassian Data Center in our non-production JIRA Data Center environments. The integration with IDP works well, however it does not play well with local system accounts, or local service accounts. As it stands, you either have to accept that your current Windows credentials session will claim your login (when set as primary auth), or you have to enter the system through the IDP site itself, leaving the option to login locally or the old fashioned way as the only option at the JIRA instance (secondary auth). The second option is not appealing, since there is no obvious indication that SAML authentication is available to a user at all, and frankly, will be rarely utilized if an additional step is needed (navigating to the IDP site to then be redirected to JIRA).

 

What we'd like to suggest: If secondary auth is selected, simply add a button in the login panel that gives the option to login with SAML as well. This would allow users to still login with system accounts (in our case, the main system administrator account), while still allowing SAML functionality as an option, and would not require users to navigate to a secondary site to do so.
fields.summary: Friendly SAML Authentication Integration With Local Accounts

fields.description:
h3. Summary:
JIRA Health Check is showing the "Check" symbol for Database collation even though it is not supported.

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Set the system locale to *en_US.UTF-8*
# Install Postgres and create a database where the collation would be *en_US.UTF-8*
# Install JIRA and connect it to the newly created database.
# Follow the Setup Wizard until it finishes.
# Navigate to "Troubleshooting and support tools" page.

h3. Expected Result:
* JIRA Health Check will show the warning for the Database Collation.

h3. Actual Result:
* JIRA Health Check would have the "Check" icon for the database just like there is no issue even though there is with the message below:
{code}The database collation 'en_US.UTF-8' is unsupported by JIRA. The Table collation 'DEFAULT' is supported by JIRA. A limited number of circumstances could cause unexpected results.{code}
fields.summary: Health Check set the Database Collation status to "OK" when it is not.

fields.description:
h2. Summary

Jira when processing incomming mail will increase the pcounter in project setup to create issues via email. However while processing the email it will not create an issue (no details are give at the time) and the pcounter is not decremented. As a result some customers are seeing jumps of 100's to 1000's in number gaps.

h2. Environment

Jira 7.3.6

h2. Steps to Reproduce

    Setup processing mail to create issues.

h2. Expected Results

pcounter should be decremented if issue is not created.

h2. Actual Results

pcounter just increases and no issues are created.

h2. Workaround

Verify no bad emails in mailbox.
fields.summary: When processing emails Jira will increase the project pcounter then not create an issue

fields.description:
Dear Atlassian support,

I work for the European Space Agency and we are not happy at all with what it seems to be your new policy: to encourage customers to keep you SW up to date as it comes with improvements but as well with surprises: functionalities that were free now are charged!. It's not fair to miss functionalities after upgrades and be forced to pay for something that was free in oldest versions. It doesn't make any sense. 

For instance, we are using now JIRA 7.3.1 and:

1.- The JIRA Suite Utilities plugin was free for previous JIRA versions (latest version that is free is v1.5.4) but this version only supports up to JIRA v7.3.8. This means that when we upgrade JIRA again, we will need to purchase a licence (so we have already requested it).

2.- We have lost the Export to Excel functionality. There is a workaround so we can use it
{quote}[https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Core-questions/JIRA-7-2-x-Excel-export-gone/qaq-p/231223]
{quote}
but we get an error (File format does not match extension). This is because the XLS file produced by JIRA is actually a HTML file that Excel can import, but again, it was working OK in and older version and again buying a plugin [Better Excel Plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.midori.jira.plugin.betterexcel/server/overview] (https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60667) would solve the issue.

This is not the way to gain customer loyalty. Since when upgrading a SW has more cons than pros?...
fields.summary: COMPLAINT - not fair to miss functionalities after upgrades and be forced to pay for something that was free in oldest versions

fields.description:
Our permission searches used with Lucene are sub optimal now.

The inefficiencies include:
 # Creating many single TermQueries connected with OR operator. 
 # Adding project queries with additional constraints when project query without constraint is already in the query. eg projid:123 OR (projid:123 AND reporter:USERNAM). 
 # Unnecessary nesting single clause queries. Instead of on query we create two Boolean queries eg (+(projid:123)) this is equal to projid:123

This is problematic as permission query is evaluated against every single segment of Lucene index. This means that JIRA searches degrades when new segments are added. Addition of segments happen when:
 # Issues are modified or added 
 # Background reindex is performend

Number of segments is reduced to 1 when full foreground reindex is done. 

We can eliminate above inefficiencies and rewrite multiple term queries into single MultiTermQuery.
fields.summary: Optimise permission queries for searches

h3. Summary
It's possible to get a list of dashboards via REST API (https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/server/#api/2/dashboard-list). However, there isn't any similar endpoints for filters

h3. Suggestion
Create an endpoint to be able to list filters via REST API

At the moment it's possible to get a list of dashboards along with their IDs (https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/server/#api/2/dashboard-list). However, there is no way to delete the dashboard via REST API

Add a checkbox: "Clone Links" to the dialog, the same as for cloning as issues.

fields.description:
h2. Summary

Issuing a rest API call or JQL that have sub-tasks as part of their results will fail with a Null Pointer Exception if the parent of the sub-task had been deleted on a different node.


 Based on the stack trace written to the JIRA log files we understand that:

1) A rest API call is issued on one node (lets suppose NODE_A) of the JIRA DC cluster.
 2) As part of processing the results for the rest API call or JQL, a sub-task is converted into an issue.
 3) To convert the sub-task, its respective parent needs to be found.
 4) JIRA tries to get the parent of the subtask from cache (on NODE_A as it is the node where the rest call or JQL were issued) and does not find it.
 5) JIRA then goes to get the parent of the subtask from the database and does not find it either. Instead, a NULL value is returned as the result from the SELECT statement.
 It is likely that the parent of the sub-task had been deleted on any other node apart from NODE_A within the JIRA DC cluster (and hence from the database) however the lucene index on that NODE_A was not yet updated.
 At this point is where we find the inconsistency as the value found in the Lucene index cannot be found in the database.
 6) The rest API call (or JQL) fails and an exception is written to the log file.

*It must be stressed that the Lucene index is eventually consistent, which means that there will be some delay in updating the index across all nodes.*
h2. Environment
 * JIRA Data Center with more than one node.
 * JIRA single node (it is less likely to happen but still can happen)

h2. Steps to Reproduce

There no specific steps to reproduce this problem. The only way to reproduce it would be in a controlled environment and setting breakpoints in the JIRA code.
h2. Expected Results

JIRA should handle this in a different way, detecting that a NULL value was returned from the SELECT statement and deducting (as the database is our source) that due to eventual consistency the lucene index had not been updated yet. Then, handling the inconsistency rather than throwing a NULL pointer exception.
h2. Actual Results

The rest API call fails and the below exception is thrown in the JIRA log files file.

(!) Please note that the below exception shows a rest API causing it as this was how it was reported however this can be caused by a JQL as well and hence the stack trace might be different. The key for this issue is the stack trace reported below "Caused by:".

 
{code:java}
2017-08-03 01:57:46,291 ajp-nio-127.0.0.1-8009-exec-3549 ERROR srvCatalyst 117x12153229x1 1y091dw 10.147.129.135 /rest/api/2/search [c.a.j.rest.exception.ExceptionInterceptor] Returning internal server error in response
java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor1098.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.interceptor.impl.DispatchProviderHelper$TypeOutInvoker$1.invoke(DispatchProviderHelper.java:169)
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.interceptor.impl.DispatchProviderHelper$1.intercept(DispatchProviderHelper.java:83)
	... 3 filtered
	at com.atlassian.jira.rest.exception.ExceptionInterceptor.intercept(ExceptionInterceptor.java:55)
	... 1 filtered
	at com.atlassian.jira.rest.v2.issue.scope.RequestScopeInterceptor.intercept(RequestScopeInterceptor.java:39)
	... 14 filtered
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.module.RestDelegatingServletFilter$JerseyOsgiServletContainer.doFilter(RestDelegatingServletFilter.java:154)
	... 1 filtered
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.module.RestDelegatingServletFilter.doFilter(RestDelegatingServletFilter.java:68)
	... 36 filtered
	at com.atlassian.web.servlet.plugin.request.RedirectInterceptingFilter.doFilter(RedirectInterceptingFilter.java:21)
	... 53 filtered
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.JiraSecurityFilter.lambda$doFilter$0(JiraSecurityFilter.java:76)
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.JiraSecurityFilter.dt_access$218(JiraSecurityFilter.java)
	... 1 filtered
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.JiraSecurityFilter.doFilter(JiraSecurityFilter.java:74)
	... 16 filtered
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.module.servlet.RestSeraphFilter.doFilter(RestSeraphFilter.java:37)
	... 20 filtered
	at com.atlassian.jira.servermetrics.CorrelationIdPopulatorFilter.doFilter(CorrelationIdPopulatorFilter.java:30)
	... 10 filtered
	at com.atlassian.web.servlet.plugin.request.RedirectInterceptingFilter.doFilter(RedirectInterceptingFilter.java:21)
	... 4 filtered
	at com.atlassian.web.servlet.plugin.LocationCleanerFilter.doFilter(LocationCleanerFilter.java:36)
	... 29 filtered
	at com.atlassian.jira.servermetrics.MetricsCollectorFilter.doFilter(MetricsCollectorFilter.java:25)
	... 27 filtered
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
	at org.apache.tomcat.util.threads.TaskThread$WrappingRunnable.run(TaskThread.java:61)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
Caused by: com.google.common.cache.CacheLoader$InvalidCacheLoadException: CacheLoader returned null for key 2276745.
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$Segment.getAndRecordStats(LocalCache.java:2350)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$Segment.loadSync(LocalCache.java:2320)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$Segment.lockedGetOrLoad(LocalCache.java:2282)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$Segment.get(LocalCache.java:2197)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache.get(LocalCache.java:3937)
	at com.atlassian.jira.rest.v2.issue.IssueBeanBuilder2.createParentLink(IssueBeanBuilder2.java:317)
	at com.atlassian.jira.rest.v2.issue.IssueBeanBuilder2.build(IssueBeanBuilder2.java:155)
	at com.atlassian.jira.rest.v2.search.SearchResource$IssueToIssueBean.apply(SearchResource.java:291)
	at com.atlassian.jira.rest.v2.search.SearchResource$IssueToIssueBean.apply(SearchResource.java:275)
	at com.google.common.collect.Lists$TransformingRandomAccessList$1.transform(Lists.java:617)
	at com.google.common.collect.TransformedIterator.next(TransformedIterator.java:48)
	at java.util.AbstractCollection.toArray(AbstractCollection.java:141)
	at java.util.ArrayList.<init>(ArrayList.java:177)
	at com.google.common.collect.Lists.newArrayList(Lists.java:144)
	at com.atlassian.jira.rest.v2.search.SearchResource.asResultsBean(SearchResource.java:217)
	at com.atlassian.jira.rest.v2.search.SearchResource.search(SearchResource.java:179)
	at com.atlassian.jira.rest.v2.search.SearchResource.searchUsingSearchRequest(SearchResource.java:203)
	... 237 more
{code}
 
h2. Workaround

*The workaround is to re-issue the rest API call or JQL as eventually will not fail, once the lucene index is updated on the node running the rest API or JQL.*
 * Note that the index may not always update. In this case, please run a project re-index.

(!) Observed a case where issue the REST API call and project reindex had NOT solved the issue, only a full reindex.
 * Project reindex does not always fix the issue, but a full reindex, recreating the indices 


h3. Note on Fix
In Jira 8.12 we have change how Index replication works and added Jira Document Based Replication (DBR), this means documents are only created on the source node (where the action triggering the change happened) and the document is then distributed to all other nodes.  Check [Document-based replication in Jira Data Center|https://confluence.atlassian.com/enterprise/document-based-replication-in-jira-data-center-1021214730.html] page for more details. 

As part of the DBR change, there are other changes, which we belive *prevent or self-heal the problem mentioned in this ticket*: 
 * we have added *versioning of all entities* - now every change which triggers an issue, comment or worklog reindex bumps this entity version (bumping the version is only triggered by user actions, not full/background re-index) 
 * all index updates (except full-foreground re-index) are now doing a *conditional update*: we only update the index if the entity in the index is older/equal (in therms of versioning - not time) to the new entity: this gives us a guarantee that all update conflicts will be resolved on all nodes with the same result; when doing a full re-index we have a clean index and there are no concurrent index updates so the index updates are non-conditional;
 * on both server and DC there is a task running every 5sec which *checks the consistency* of the recent (last 15 sec) changes in the index and re-applies deletes if there was a late update which has overridden the delete (conditional updates do not solve this problem); this task checks for the consistency of updates as well to handle corner cases like thread was gone after updating the DB (for DC this is the index replication table, for server the entity version table) but before updating the local index
fields.summary: Null Pointer Exception thrown due to JIRA not handling correctly an inconsistency between the database and the lucene index.

fields.description:
*Issue detail view*
+*Problem:*+ Currently only fields with values are displayed in the issue detail view, blank fields are not displayed regardless which prevents updating of the field in the view. For example, if the sprint or epic fields are blank, they are not visible or editable on the screen and can only be edited if you are in edit mode of the issue.

+*Request:*+ Show blank fields regardless to allow editing of sprint, story points, and epic fields on the page without having to enter edit issue screen.
fields.summary: Improve the backlog and issue detail views

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, Jira allows users to set an announcement banner at the top of the page. Usually, administrators use that space to notification/alert users about upcoming upgrades, downtimes, unexpected outages.

There are cases when the administrators need to show informational messages (permanent) in all the pages, like a security requirement saying the instance is approved or has confidential data.

h3. Suggested Solution

Usually, the purpose of the two kinds of messages mentioned above (Notification / Informative) doesn't mix well.
It would be good to provide the administrator with an announcement banner positioned at the bottom of the page.

h3. Workaround

Inject JavaScript and CSS (let say to the top banner) to position the message at the bottom. But this solution has limitations and may not render well.
fields.summary: Option to include an anouncement banner at the bottom of the page.

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
The time of an evaluation license to be expired is unpredictable. Some evaluation license might even expire a day earlier than the expected date.

h3. Steps to reproduce the issue
# Generate a few evaluation licenses for Service Desk in different time zones.
# Apply the evaluation license in Jira.
# Change the server date to the expiry date of the evaluation license.
# Adjust the server time to estimate the time that the evaluation license gets expired and cause https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3217. Note down the estimated time.
# Repeat steps 2 - 4 with another evaluation license.

h3. Expected result
The evaluation licenses stop working only on next day of the expiry date.

h3. Actual result
The licenses might expire a day earlier or any time on the expiry day.
fields.summary: The expiry date and time of an evaluation license is unpredictable

fields.description:
h3. Summary
At the moment, the only options to export issues to CSV or the other options are:

# All Fields
# Current Fields

This can be challenging when you have hundreds of custom fields and you do not want to export All Fields (for performance or cleanup reasons). 

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow users to customize their search request exports based on certain filters or criteria. E.G. exporting only the fields that are not null for the current result set. This will allow for better performance as well as provide more options for migrations via CSV exports.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like the ability to customize search request exports

fields.description:
We are running on Atlassian JIRA [Project Management Software|https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira] (v6.3.8#6338-sha1:68f19fa). We don't see any delete button in Screens even though most of the screens not linked to any workflows / issue types. 

Please let me know how to enable that option to cleanup orphan screens.
fields.summary: No Delete button on Screens

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, if customer import issues from Bugzilla to JIRA using JIM plugin, multiple fields from Bugzilla's "Platform" section will be imported to single field named "Environment" in JIRA.

User would like JIM plugin to import data from the "Platform" field to individual fields.

 Eg: OS and Platform fields from Bugzilla is imported to JIRA with identical field name rather than moving them to generic "Environment" field.


h3. Suggested Solution

Make JIM plugin to import data from the "Platform" field to individual fields.


h3. Workaround 

Manually create the customfields and import the data from the Platform fields from Bugzilla to JIRA using CSV importer.
fields.summary: Improve Bugzilla Field Import

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
On large instances, seeing 5 minutes Cluster Lock warning for Full Synchronisation on External User directory.

h3. Suggested Solution
Possible improvement can be made:
* For external users more than 30k, increase Cluster Lock warning to 10 minutes for specific {{com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.api.Directory}} entry.

h3. Why this is important
Remove unnecessary alert to Administrators

h3. Notes 
We should not remove the Cluster Lock check altogether as it may be hitting into other possible problem such as:
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/unlimited-ldap-read-timeout-can-cause-cluster-locks-health-check-to-fail-if-there-are-communication-issues-872007358.html
fields.summary: Improve Cluster Lock Health Check
The AdhocNotificationService should not send multiple emails to the same recipient when a user is in multiple roles of the issue

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*
 
In instances where JIRA acts as the User Server for another Atlassian application (such as Bitbucket Server), user renames in accounts managed in a Delegated LDAP directory will cause the creation of a new account in the downstream application after a synch.  
 
h3. *How to Replicate*
 
# Setup Delegated LDAP in Jira. Leave "Copy User on Login" disabled and use defaults for the rest of the User Directory. 
# Create User in LDAP.
# Create User in Jira. Assign Permissions.
# Setup Jira UserDirectory in Bitbucket/Fecru. Sync users.
# Login with user in Bitbucket and create personal repo (for validation purposes later).
# Change username (cn) in LDAP.
# Change username in Jira to reflect change in LDAP. Either via WebUI or api call.
# Log into Bitbucket with new user.
Note the personal repo is not associated as this is a new user and not a modified user

h3. *Expected Results*
User name change will propegate with no other changes to the account

h3.  *Actual Results*
A new account is created with the new user name and the old account is not active or accessible.

h3.  *Workaround*
There is no known workaround at this time.
fields.summary: Username changes in delegated LDAP directories result in new accounts being created in downstream JIRA User Server connected applications

fields.description:
It would be incredibly useful if the "Recently Created" gadget had a "Statistics Type" field in its configuration similar to the one in the "Pie Chart" gadget's configuration.

If this were the case, instead of showing the "Resolved" and "Unresolved" segments of each column, there would be a segment for each value (limited by a specified number of values) of the specified statistic type. When a user would hover over each segment, it could show the percentage and count of issues with that specific value.

Alternatively, a new gadget could be created that is capable of providing this visualization.  May look something like this:
!image-2017-11-01-11-52-07-630.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Add statistic type to "Recently Created" gadget (or new gadget)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Reindexing an JIRA issue with a lot of change history will load all the changes for the issues. If issue has a lot changes, that resulting document will be quite big (30MB+). 
If a lot issues requested to be reindex at the same time, that will put a lot of memory pressure for {{CHANGE_HISTORY-indexQueue}} and {{QueueingIndex}} and can cause an OOME. 
Reindexing large number of issues with a lot of change history can cause an OOME.


h3. Environment
* Large number of issues (100K+) 
* Issues with a lot of change history (1k+)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Reindex issue

h3. Expected Results
JIRA performs well 

h3. Actual Results
Reindex is very slow and JVM heap usage is high (2GB+). In some cases it can cause OOM. 
 
h3. Notes
* SQL to find large number of changes per issue:
{code:SQL|borderStyle=solid}
select concat(p.pkey,'-',ji.issuenum) as issue, count (ji.id) from changeitem ci join changegroup cg on cg.id = ci.groupid join jiraissue ji on cg.issueid = ji.id join project p on p.id = ji.project group by ji.issuenum,p.pkey order by count (ji.id) DESC;
   issue    | count
------------+-------
 PRG-5      |    50
 AG-4       |    17
 AG-12      |    14
{code}
* SQL to find large number of actions (comments ... ) per issue:
{code:SQL|borderStyle=solid}
select concat(p.pkey,'-',i.issuenum) as issue, count(i.id) from jiraaction a, jiraissue i, project p where i.project = p.id and i.id = a.issueid group by p.pkey,i.issuenum order by count (i.id) DESC;
{code}

Dominator tree from heap dump:
 !JRASERVER_66251_dom_tree.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
* This is not a good workaround, but you might consider delete issues with large history
fields.summary: Reindexing large number of issues with a lot of change history can cause an OOME

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary
* When using the Visual Tab, the line breaks are double, when using the Text tab, they are single. This should be consistent across the all the text fields.

h5. Steps to Reproduce
 * Go to a multi-line field like the 'Comments' in an issue.
 * With 'Text' tab selected, write and hit enter (repeat several times), then switch to 'Visual' tab and write and hit enter (again, repeat several times).

h5. Expected Behavior
 * When you are in Text tab, all line breaks are single. When switching to Visual, all line breaks remain as single-line. 

h5. Actual Behavior
 * Line breaks added in 'Visual' tab are translated as double line breaks in 'Text' tab. Line breaks added in 'Text' tab stay as single ones when switching to 'Visual' tab. This is not consistent: 
!text vs visual.png|thumbnail! 
  
h5. Cause
* Unknown.

 
h5. Workaround
 * Always using Text tab if you want to preserve the single-line-break behavior.
fields.summary: Visual Tab from Rich Text Editor inserts double line break

fields.description:
Icons/avatars for Issue types are inconsistent. The basic ones are SVGs, but when I create a new service desk project with the ITIL template, those new icons are PNGs. At least everything that comes from the Atlassian base products should be one format.

 !image-2017-11-01-22-32-44-413.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Standardize the file types used in JIRA

There are request for many reports to exist as gadgets.

I would suggest that you solve them al togheter and make sure report charts always(when possible) should be able to be added as a gadget.

fields.description:
As seen in SDS-28234, leading (and possibly trailing) spaces on file attachments may break the link to download the files (see screenshot attached).
Adding a function to strip blank spaces at the start and end of file names could prevent this behavior.
fields.summary: Strip leading and trailing blank spaces when uploading file attachments.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

On Linux, when upgrading a Jira installation using the installer ([Upgrading JIRA applications using a rapid upgrade method|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/upgrading-jira-applications-using-a-rapid-upgrade-method-802592264.html]), the installer will fail to remove the existing installation directory if the directory is a mount point.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Jira on a mount point. e.g.:
{noformat}
Filesystem     1K-blocks    Used Available Use% Mounted on
/dev/fakedev0    1479088    2240   1383664   1% /jira
{noformat}
#* On this example, Jira was installed on the {{/jira}} directory.
# After setting up the application, proceed with upgrading it with the linux installer.

h3. Expected Results

The installer is able to perform all the necessary steps to remove the old installation files/folder and replace them with the new files.

h3. Actual Results

The installer will fail with the following message:

{noformat}
Deleting the previous JIRA installation directory...
Error while attempting to remove the previous installation directory. Some files may be in use. Please close all related programs and try again.
Ignore [i, Enter], Retry [r], Quit [q]
{noformat}

Checking the installation folder will confirm that it is currently empty, leaving only the mount point in place.
 
h3.Workaround
Move the installation directory to a directory inside the mount point, such as {{/jira/jira/}}
fields.summary: Installer unable to upgrade installation placed on mount point

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Unable to search using JQL for strings containing special characters. The proper escape characters were used. Example of string:
{code:java}
[Toto]
{code}
Search using JQL below:
{code:java}
summary ~ "\\[Toto\\]"
{code}
h5. Expected Results
 # [TOTO] test 1
 # Test 2[Toto]
 # [Toto]test 3

h5. Actual Results
 # [TOTO] test 1
 # Test 2[Toto]
 # [Toto]test 3
 # toto test 4
 # "toto" test 5

As seen from the actual results, searching for :
{code:java}
summary ~ "\\[Toto\\]"
{code}
is the same as searching for
{code:java}
summary ~ "Toto"
{code}
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow JQL searches with special characters.
h3. Workaround

Search using the custom field ID instead. The custom field ID is usually shown beside the custom field name when typing it in Advanced Searching.
fields.summary: As a Jira user, I want to be able to run a JQL search with special characters

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition:
It appears that JIRA Project "Users and Roles" page will be showing "License" column if there is more than one License application applied to one JIRA. But, this information is not being mentioned in the documentation below:
- [Managing Project Roles|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver075/managing-project-roles-935391162.html]

h3. Suggested Solution:
Update the documentation with the information regarding the Column where it will show if there is more than one application license applied to one JIRA instance. e.g. JIRA Software and JIRA Service Desk license in one JIRA.
fields.summary: Information regarding the "License" column

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Current embedded JRE has some vulnerabilities which have been resolved in critical security update Java 1.8.0.171. Many larger companies which have a dedicated security team will ask their JIRA system admin to update the Java version to the new critical security update. Which forces the JIRA system admin to sway away from sticking to the embedded version.

[https://www.java.com/en/download/faq/release_changes.xml]
h3. Suggested Solution

Test and bundle with the latest Java 1.8.0.171 into the new update of JIRA.
h3. Workaround 

If the customer is requested to update Java before a new JIRA release with the required java update comes out, they can update their Java versions manually by following these KB articles;
 * [How to use system JRE instead of embedded JRE|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/how-to-use-system-jre-instead-of-embedded-jre-303661422.html]
 * [How to use JDK or JRE exclusively on JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-use-a-jdk-or-jre-exclusively-on-jira-765594330.html]
fields.summary: Embed latest java critical security update (1.8.0.171 or higher) into the next JIRA (sub)version

fields.description:
Many people use the JIRA notifications as a way to triage updates the next morning. Beyond using keyword filters (which is difficult to do) there isn't an easy way to review the email notifications for important changes.

 

Building a tighter integration with email clients (especially Gmail) in order to display some key information and quick links (similar to how the google Drive quick info works) would really improve how we use the email notifications to triage updates to tickets and know which ones we can just archive.

 

I've attached a screenshot showing an example of how it could work (from google's Inbox app for iOS).
fields.summary: Better Gmail integration to display Project / User / Change Type in the subject field

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In Jira Data Center during cache replication value of ehcache.listener.socketTimeoutMillis from clustered.properties(or a default value) should be used as read timeout for remote RMI calls to other nodes in cluster. Instead an infinity is used. Problems with communication with one node can bring entire cluster down.
h3. Environment
 * JIRA datacenter with multiple nodes
 *Node A* is unresponsive because of extremely high load or high memory pressure or any other condition that makes it unresponsive. However, at this state node is not technically down and still registered as an 'Active' member in the cluster but not processing request either.
 *Node B* still consider node *A* as 'Active' so it keeps performing cache synchronisation to Node A which not responding to the request and put Node B in stale position. 

h3. Diagnostic 

Node B's thread dump shows lots of thread performing cache sync. Those threads tend to hang on java.rmi.Naming.lookup()
{code:java}
 java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
        at java.net.SocketInputStream.socketRead0(Native Method)
        at java.net.SocketInputStream.socketRead(SocketInputStream.java:116)
        at java.net.SocketInputStream.read(SocketInputStream.java:170)
        at java.net.SocketInputStream.read(SocketInputStream.java:141)
        at java.io.BufferedInputStream.fill(BufferedInputStream.java:246)
        at java.io.BufferedInputStream.read(BufferedInputStream.java:265)
        - locked <0x00000004b8012be8> (a java.io.BufferedInputStream)
        at sun.rmi.transport.tcp.TCPConnection.isDead(TCPConnection.java:192)
        at sun.rmi.transport.tcp.TCPChannel.newConnection(TCPChannel.java:191)
        at sun.rmi.server.UnicastRef.newCall(UnicastRef.java:342)
        at sun.rmi.registry.RegistryImpl_Stub.lookup(Unknown Source)
        at java.rmi.Naming.lookup(Naming.java:101)
        at net.sf.ehcache.distribution.RMICacheManagerPeerProvider.lookupRemoteCachePeer(RMICacheManagerPeerProvider.java:127)
        at com.atlassian.jira.cluster.distribution.JiraCacheManagerPeerProvider.listRemoteCachePeers(JiraCacheManagerPeerProvider.java:93)
        at net.sf.ehcache.distribution.RMISynchronousCacheReplicator.listRemoteCachePeers(RMISynchronousCacheReplicator.java:335)
        at net.sf.ehcache.distribution.RMISynchronousCacheReplicator.replicateRemovalNotification(RMISynchronousCacheReplicator.java:239)
        at net.sf.ehcache.distribution.RMISynchronousCacheReplicator.notifyElementRemoved(RMISynchronousCacheReplicator.java:229)
        at net.sf.ehcache.event.RegisteredEventListeners.internalNotifyElementRemoved(RegisteredEventListeners.java:144)
        at net.sf.ehcache.event.RegisteredEventListeners.notifyElementRemoved(RegisteredEventListeners.java:124)
        at net.sf.ehcache.Cache.notifyRemoveInternalListeners(Cache.java:2322)
        at net.sf.ehcache.Cache.removeInternal(Cache.java:2305)
        at net.sf.ehcache.Cache.remove(Cache.java:2207)
        at net.sf.ehcache.Cache.remove(Cache.java:2125)
        at net.sf.ehcache.constructs.EhcacheDecoratorAdapter.remove(EhcacheDecoratorAdapter.java:154)
        at com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.LoadingCache.remove(LoadingCache.java:208)
        at com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.DelegatingCache.remove(DelegatingCache.java:134)
{code}
h3. Expected 

Requests performing java.rmi.Naming.lookup() operations will throw Exception after specified timeout.
h3. Actual

Requests performing java.rmi.Naming.lookup() hang indefinitely stalling *Node B*.
h3. Workaround

Restart/shutdown node that is unresponsive
fields.summary: ehcache.listener.socketTimeoutMillis is not used during Naming.lookup of CachePeer

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, Jira only supports POSIX.UTF-8 or C.UTF-8 or C or POSIX as the collation.
h3. Suggested Solution

Have Jira support {{*.UTF-8}} collation (e.g. {{en_US.UTF-8}}, {{ja_JP.UTF-8}}) for PostgreSQL
h3. Why this is important

Amazon AWS RDS has limited collation for PostgreSQL and {{en_US.UTF-8}} is set as a default collation.
 * Based on the discussion in Community, the collation is not easily updated - [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Software-questions/PostgreSQL-SSL-Configuration-Causes-Collation-Exception-on/qaq-p/649814]
 * Clients that are hosting Jira Data Center on AWS RDS with PostgreSQL would want to be on supported collation

h3. Workaround

Move to the supported collation referring to [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-fix-the-collation-of-a-postgres-jira-database-776657961.html]
fields.summary: Support PostgreSQL en_US.UTF-8 collation

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In MySQL 5.7.6, a change was made to require that the database user now needs the "REFERENCES" permission to be able to create the foreign key constraints.   Jira, starting with 7.3.x, does offer support for MySQL 5.7.x.   We have updated the Jira documentation to reflect this change, but it would still be helpful if Jira was more proactive in regards to halting all functions when this permission is missing.   The reason this would be helpful is that users setting up jira for the first time on this database platform could easily missing this one permission needed, and as a result it would be easy for their system to get into a broken state rather quickly without it being readily apparent.


h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great if either Jira or the healthchecks in Jira could both detect this situation and halt the system during startup if it is missing this permission.

h3. Why this is important
Since MySQL changed to require this starting with 5.7.6, and Jira simply doesn't work correctly without this permission, it would be better to have Jira come to a complete halt rather than continue to work in a semi-broken state.   For example, if you setup the database this way, it does appear that Jira works, but Jira Software tends to be unable to create the Rank field correctly and provide correct lexorank marker values for that rank field when the Jira-software plugin starts up.
fields.summary: Jira should detect when MySQL database is missing needed permissions

fields.description:
From [PS-15126|https://getsupport.atlassian.com/browse/PS-15126?focusedCommentId=12762190&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-12762190] where it was demonstrated 2 nodes out of 5 stopped processing cluster messages without explanation:
bq. Is there any logging we can add that would inform us when clustermessagehandler stops processing messages?

From development:
bq. I don't see any extra logs that we could enable. The class seems to lack the basic logs to debug cases like this one. They can and should be added to provide a tool for support.
fields.summary: Need additional logging on clustermessage classes

fields.description:
Hi,

actually it is not possible to size features or issues which are subtasks in order to size the Sprint-effort. It would be great if JIRA allows the sizing of each dedicated sub task, to assign a sub task to a dedicated user and the accumalation of the different subtaks-.sizings in the main task!

Best regards, Christian
fields.summary: Dedicated sizing (Story Points) for subtasks

fields.description: Currently the Confluence Jira issues macro relies upon the permissions set up in Jira. If a user does not have permissions to view a project in Jira, they are unable to view issues within the macro in Confluence. We would like a way to allow users to view the issues in a Confluence macro without having full view permissions within Jira. It seems most intuitive to add this as a configuration option on the Jira permissions side (at the project level), rather than a base feature on the macro in Confluence.
fields.summary: Allow for viewing Jira issues macro in Confluence without needing project permissions in Jira

fields.summary: Could we share Production JIRA license to DR server

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Some random PDFs cannot be loaded in JIRA when accessing it via IIS proxy with ARR.

h3. Environment
Windows OS with IIS proxy


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup an IIS proxy with ARR plugin in JIRA following [Integrating JIRA applications with IIS using ARR|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/integrating-jira-applications-with-iis-using-arr-313467089.html]
# Access JIRA with proxy and upload PDF files
# Click on the PDF file

h3. Expected Behaviour
PDF will be correctly displayed

h3. Actual Result
It loads infinitely and throws 502 Bad Gateway Error

h3. Note 
The PDF is correctly displayed when bypassing the proxy

h3. Workarounds
* By [~jconroy]:  {quote}ARR proxy has a default chunk size of 256k.  It will download, cache and rechunk the file before it gets sent to the client. ARR also uses a response buffer with a 256k threshold.  In my analysis I've found ARR is not able to detect when the last chunk has been received (best guess is pdf-viewer is using a method not supported by ARR).  When ARR receives the httpresponse close, anything left in the response buffer is dropped and causes a 502.3 error.

Resolution:

Disabling Disk Cache on the proxy server will complete resolve the issue.  Additionally I recommend setting the response buffer threshold to 0 and setting the proxy keep-alive timeout from 30 to 180 seconds.  Although not required to fix this issue, the response buffer is know to cause issues with real-time bidirectional techniques such as SignalR, and the 30 second keep-alive can cause too frequent disconnects with other applications.{quote}
* Increasing the keep-alive time seems to help in some cases.
fields.summary: Loading PDF when accessing via IIS with ARR

fields.description:
h3. Summary
There are some warning messages in the log file when adding an attachment to a JIRA issue. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Take a printscreen or copy a picture into memory; {{Ctrl+c}}.
# Navigate to issue view screen in JIRA.
# Press {{Ctrl+v}}, {{Attach screenshot}} window should pop up.
# Click on "Upload".

h3. Expected Results
Attachment is added and no warning messages in the log file.

h3. Actual Results
Attachment is added, but you get a series of warnings in {{atlassian-jira.log}} file:
{noformat}
2017-10-29 10:09:19,123 http-nio-8750-exec-25 WARN admin 609x5002x1 1x9am3h xx.xx.xx.xx /secure/ShowAttachScreenshotFormAction.jspa [c.a.j.w.a.issue.util.BackwardCompatibleTemporaryAttachmentUtil] Using deprecated method for adding attachments to issue! Someone still uses TemporaryAttachmentsMonitor - you can probably track him by looking at the referrer or previous requests to JIRA.
2017-10-29 10:09:19,145 http-nio-8750-exec-25 WARN admin 609x5002x1 1x9am3h xx.xx.xx.xx /secure/ShowAttachScreenshotFormAction.jspa [c.a.j.issue.managers.DefaultAttachmentManager] Temporary attachment missing: 8390060816817697834
2017-10-29 10:09:19,175 http-nio-8750-exec-25 WARN admin 609x5002x1 1x9am3h xx.xx.xx.xx /secure/ShowAttachScreenshotFormAction.jspa [c.a.j.issue.fields.AttachmentSystemField] There were errors while converting temporary attachments: AttachmentError{logMessage='Temporary attachment missing: 8390060816817697834', localizedMessage='Unable to find temporary attachment.', filename='#8390060816817697834', reason=VALIDATION_FAILED, exception=none()}
{noformat}

h3.Workaround - Temporary
This is useful when you want to see if the problem is resolved, or can't afford an application restart:

* Go to Jira Admin > Logging and Profiling
* Click "Configure logging level for another package"
* Add each class name shown below, with the level set to {{ERROR}}
{code}
com.atlassian.jira.web.action.issue.util.BackwardCompatibleTemporaryAttachmentUtil
com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultAttachmentManager
com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.AttachmentSystemField
{code}

h3.Workaround - Permanent
You can add the following to {{$jira-install/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/log4j.properties}} - and restart Jira.

{code}
# Reduce Log Spam from https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-66226 when folks paste attachments in:
log4j.logger.com.atlassian.jira.web.action.issue.util.BackwardCompatibleTemporaryAttachmentUtil = ERROR, console, filelog
log4j.additivity.com.atlassian.jira.web.action.issue.util.BackwardCompatibleTemporaryAttachmentUtil = false
log4j.logger.com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultAttachmentManager = ERROR, console, filelog
log4j.additivity.com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultAttachmentManager = false
log4j.logger.com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.AttachmentSystemField = ERROR, console, filelog
log4j.additivity.com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.AttachmentSystemField = false
{code}
fields.summary: Attachment warning message in log file

fields.description:
h3. Problem
Today, admins can only set the visibility level of the Announcement banner as *Public - Show to anyone* or *Private - Show to logged in users only*. Logged in users will see the announcement banner no matter which option is being chosen, even if the content is only meant for non-logged in users.

h3. Suggestion
Option to show Announcement banner to *non-logged in users only*. Dashboard gadgets would help to some extent but non-logged in users may be able to use Issue navigator or browse projects and not seeing the information in the dashboard.
fields.summary: Option to show Announcement banner to non-logged in users only

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Attempting to build Jira from source will fail to build as resources are required from an internal registry not open to the public.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Attempt to build Jira from source by initiating ./build.sh
h3. Expected Results

Jira build completes successfully
h3. Actual Results

The build fails due to connection failures. Resources from an internal registry [https://npm-private.atlassian.io|https://npm-private.atlassian.io/] can't be obtained.
h3. Notes

There are 3 files that reference the internal registry

<source>/jira-project/yarn.lock
 <source>/jira-project/jira-components/jira-webapp/src/main/resources/johnson-page/yarn.lock
 <source>/jira-project/conf/frontend/npm/preinstall.js

The build fails because the registry is not a public registry and the build log shows:
{code:java}
[INFO] verbose 1.072 Error: https://npm-private.atlassian.io/@atlassian%2feslint-config-jira-fecq/-/@atlassian%2feslint-config-jira-fecq-3.1.0.tgz: Request failed "401 Unauthorized"
{code}
 
h3. Workaround

No workaround for building source. Jira must be installed with standard binary/installer.
fields.summary: Jira 7.4.0 and higher cannot be built from source due to internal NPM registry

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When multiple Jira instances are applinked to a Bitbucket instance, a user may see unexpected commits when viewing an issue. This can occur under two conditions:
 * The same project name and issue key are in use across multiple instances (expected).
 * A project originally had the same name across multiple instances but has been renamed to a unique value (not expected).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create two Jira instances.
 # Create new projects with the same name/key across both instances (e.g., *FOO*).
 # Rename (name and key) the project on _one_ instance (e.g., *BAR*).
 # Create a test issue in each project (e.g., *FOO-1*, *BAR-1)*.
 # Link both Jira instances to a Bitbucket instance.
 # Create a repo in BB for each project.
 # Commit a file in Bitbucket and reference the issue key for each project in the respective commit message (e.g. *commit -m* "*FOO-1 test commit"* and *commit -m* "*BAR-1 test commit"*)

h3. Expected Results

Only commits relevant to this particular issue should be observed when viewing issues in their respective Jira instances.
h3. Actual Results

When navigating to issue *BAR-1* you'll see commits for both  *FOO-1* and *BAR-1*.
When navigating to issue *FOO-1* you'll only see a commit for *FOO-1*.
h3. Workaround

Creating a backup, deleting and re-importing project *BAR* from backup will resolve the problem. You will only see commits for ***BAR-1*.
fields.summary: Unexpected commits can be observed when multiple Jira instances are applinked to BitBucket

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, when there is a problem during form submission (Field is empty and etc), the error message appears below the affected field. Users have difficulty identifying the problem at first glance especially if the form has many fields.

h3. Suggestion

Add the error message at the top of the form so that it is visible both around the field and the top of the form, immediately after form submission.
fields.summary: Improve display position of error messages during form submission

fields.description:
h3. Issue description

When using a custom template, the Issue collector template preview is blank in the issue collector view page, although it is not blank in the edit page.

h3. Steps to reproduce
 # In any project, go to Project Settings -> Issue Collector
 # Click on add an issue collector.
 # From the "Edit issue collector" page, select "Custom" for the Template (note that it is not needed to tick any Custom Fields to reproduce this bug)
 # Notice that the template preview is working on this page.
 # Click on "Update" to save the issue collector
 # Go back to the Project Settings -> Issue Collector page
 # Click on the name of the Issue Collector under the column "Name"


h3. Expected Result

The template preview should not be blank, like it's the case on the "Edit issue collector" page 

h3. Actual Result

The template preview is blank from this page:
 !IssueCollectorViewPage.png|thumbnail! 

Note that the template preview is not blank on the "Edit Issue collector" page:
 !IssueCollectorEditPage.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
No workaround is available; however it is possible to upgrade Jira to 7.12.0 or above (or Service Desk 3.15.0 or above).
fields.summary: Issue collector template preview is blank when using a custom template

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Definition*
Currently, we can edit mail queue service via JIRA UI to include cron expression however for incoming mail we cannot edit the services but only can remove it from services page in JIRA UI as shown below:
 !services.JPG|thumbnail! 

h3. *Suggested Solution*
Provide same option as mail queue service where incoming mail handler services can be edited in this page to include the same option as mail queue service so that we can include cron expression via JIRA UI.

h3. *Additional Note*
We can edit the scheduled time for incoming mail handler service by editing the mail handler at *JIRA Administration > system > incoming mail* how even currently it only take normal time values such as minutes or hours. Hence an option to include cron expression and ability to be edit under centralized place in JIRA would be a great plus in JIRA.
fields.summary: Allow Incoming Mail Handler Service Editted Via Services Page in JIRA UI to Include Cron Expression

When an instance is connected to MSSQL database and the */rest/usermanagement/1/user/group/nested?username* API endpoint is requested, an *Offset not supported* or *Incorrect syntax near 'offset'* error will be returned

h3. Environment
* Microsoft SQL Server database

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA connecting to MSSQL database
# Create an admin user with username of *admin*
# Configure JIRA as a user server in */secure/admin/ConfigureCrowdServer.jspa*
#* Remember the application name and password created. I used jira/jira in this example
# Run a GET request against */rest/usermanagement/1/user/group/nested?username=admin*
#* Authentication for this request is the application name and password configured (ie. jira/jira)
#* Username defined in _username=admin_ is an existing user in the instance

        <link href="http://localhost:12063/jira730/rest/usermanagement/1/group?groupname=jira-administrators" rel="self"/>
    </group>
    <group name="jira-developers">
        <link href="http://localhost:12063/jira730/rest/usermanagement/1/group?groupname=jira-developers" rel="self"/>
    </group>
    <group name="jira-users">

fields.description:
h3. Definition
I would like to have a report in JIRA where I can see how many times an issue has been transitioned from Status A to Status B. 

As an example,
ABC-1 Open to In Progress = 4
ABC -1 In Progress to Closed = 1
fields.summary: Transition Count Reporting in JIRA

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary
* When writing in a text field, if you apply a style writing the code (Like 'h5.' or 'bq.') while in the Visual tab, it applies the style but does not delete the code.

h5. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to any issue with a text field that has the RTE enabled.
# Select the Visual tab.
# Write any style code and hit space.

h5. Expected Behavior
* The style is applied, leaving the user to write anything using that style.

h5. Actual Behavior
* The style is applied, but does not delete the style code:  
*# !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
*# !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h5. Workaround
* Applying the styles using either Text tab or using the Style button.
fields.summary: Applying a text Style on Visual tab does not remove the style code in a Text field.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, JIM does not import and retain issue links from the Pivotal Tracker data.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow JIM to import issue links from the Pivotal Tracker data.
 
h3. Workaround
# Manually add the issue links after the data is imported.
# Have all the issue linking information stored in a CSV import then use the CSV importer to update existing JIRA issues to have the issue links.
fields.summary: Pivotal Tracker Import into JIRA should import issue links
